Well I've found the problem:
I made a mock-up to send you the code and it worked on my machine!?
The problem was the runtime string being used to in the Class.forName
("className") call had a space at the end, thus causing an 
exception....
god knows why it worked fine when not running thru JUnit, but it 
works now :-)

I'll remember to check for that in future...

thanks for the help and sorry if I wasted your time!!


--- In junit@y..., "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@t...> wrote:
> I'd be happy to.  Just send me a mock-up of the code and I will run 
it.
> 
> -Jason
subject: Re: ClassNotFoundException
